org.zaproxy.zap.view

Class AbstractMultipleOrderedOptionsBaseTableModel<E extends Orderable>

  • java.lang.Object
    • javax.swing.table.AbstractTableModel
      • org.zaproxy.zap.view.AbstractMultipleOptionsBaseTableModel<E>
        • org.zaproxy.zap.view.AbstractMultipleOrderedOptionsBaseTableModel<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements of this table model
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable, TableModel

    public abstract class AbstractMultipleOrderedOptionsBaseTableModel<E extends Orderable>
extends AbstractMultipleOptionsBaseTableModel<E>
    An AbstractMultipleOptionsBaseTableModel that allows its elements to be ordered.

    Allows to move the elements to top, up and down one position and to bottom. The order of the elements starts with number one.

    Note: No validations are done prior moving the elements, which might or not lead to Exceptions. The move methods should be called only when the move is known to be valid.

    Since:
    2.4.0
    See Also:
    Orderable, Serialized Form

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void moveBottom(int row)
      Moves the element at the given row to the bottom of the elements, thus occupying the last position.
      void moveDown(int row)
      Moves the element at the given row one position down, effectively switching position with the following element.
      void moveTop(int row)
      Moves the element at the given row to the top of the elements, thus occupying the first position.
      void moveUp(int row)
      Moves the element at the given row one position up, effectively switching position with the previous element.
      void removeElement(int row)
      protected void updateOrdersAndFireNotification(int startingRow)
      Updates the order of all the elements, whose row index is equal or greater to startingRow, and notifies all listeners of the changes.

    • Method Detail

      • removeElement

        public void removeElement(int row)

        Overridden to update the order of the elements after the removed element.

        Overrides:
        removeElement in class AbstractMultipleOptionsBaseTableModel<E extends Orderable>

      • moveTop

        public void moveTop(int row)
        Moves the element at the given row to the top of the elements, thus occupying the first position.

        The order of all elements is updated and all listeners notified.

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element that should be moved to the top
        See Also:
        updateOrdersAndFireNotification(int)

      • moveUp

        public void moveUp(int row)
        Moves the element at the given row one position up, effectively switching position with the previous element.

        The order of both elements is updated accordingly and all listeners notified.

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element that should be moved one position up

      • moveDown

        public void moveDown(int row)
        Moves the element at the given row one position down, effectively switching position with the following element.

        The order of both elements is updated accordingly and all listeners notified.

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element that should be moved one position down

      • moveBottom

        public void moveBottom(int row)
        Moves the element at the given row to the bottom of the elements, thus occupying the last position.

        The order of all elements is updated and all listeners notified.

        Parameters:
        row - the row of the element that should be moved to the bottom
        See Also:
        updateOrdersAndFireNotification(int)

      • updateOrdersAndFireNotification

        protected void updateOrdersAndFireNotification(int startingRow)
        Updates the order of all the elements, whose row index is equal or greater to startingRow, and notifies all listeners of the changes.
        Parameters:
        startingRow - the row index at which the update of the order should start
        See Also:
        AbstractTableModel.fireTableDataChanged()
